com.thetransactioncompany.cors
Class CORSRequestHandler

java.lang.Object
  com.thetransactioncompany.cors.CORSRequestHandler

public class CORSRequestHandler
extends java.lang.Object

Handles incoming cross-origin (CORS) requests according to the configured access policy. Encapsulates the CORS processing logic as specified by the W3C draft from 2010-07-27.

Note that the actual CORS exception handling (which is outside the CORS specification scope) is left to the invoking class to implement.

Version:
1.3.2 (2011-12-02)
Author:
Vladimir Dzhuvinov

Method Detail

checkOrigin

protected java.lang.String checkOrigin(java.lang.String[] requestOrigins)
Matches the list of request origins against the allowed origins. This is done by invoking the configuration helper method CORSConfiguration.isAllowedOrigin(java.lang.String).

Parameters:
requestOrigins - The request origins (zero or more).
Returns:
The first case-insensitive match, or null if nothing matched.

tagRequest

public void tagRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
Tags an HTTP servlet request to provide CORS information to downstream handlers.

Tagging is provided via HttpServletRequest.setAttribute().

  • cors.isCorsRequest set to true or false.
  • cors.origin set to the value of the "Origin" header, null if undefined.
  • cors.requestType set to "actual" or "preflight" (for CORS requests).
  • cors.requestHeaders set to the value of the "Access-Control-Request-Headers" or null if undefined (added for preflight CORS requests only).

Parameters:
request - The servlet request to inspect and tag. Must not be null.

handleActualRequest

public void handleActualRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                         throws InvalidCORSRequestException,
                                CORSOriginDeniedException,
                                UnsupportedHTTPMethodException
Handles a simple or actual CORS request.

CORS specification: Simple Cross-Origin Request, Actual Request, and Redirects

Parameters:
request - The HTTP request.
response - The HTTP response.
Throws:
InvalidCORSRequestException - If not a valid CORS simple/ actual request.
CORSOriginDeniedException - If the origin is not allowed.
UnsupportedHTTPMethodException - If the requested HTTP method is not supported by the CORS policy.

handlePreflightRequest

public void handlePreflightRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                            throws InvalidCORSRequestException,
                                   CORSOriginDeniedException,
                                   UnsupportedHTTPMethodException,
                                   UnsupportedHTTPHeaderException
Handles a preflight CORS request.

CORS specification: Preflight Request

Parameters:
request - The HTTP request.
response - The HTTP response.
Throws:
InvalidCORSRequestException - If not a valid CORS preflight request.
CORSOriginDeniedException - If the origin is not allowed.
UnsupportedHTTPMethodException - If the requested HTTP method is not supported by the CORS policy.
UnsupportedHTTPHeaderException - If the requested HTTP header is not supported by the CORS policy.
